website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to value, this inexpensive golf cart has a lot to offer for a budget price, including a reliable build and easy-to-fold design.
pros: Wide configuration of the wheels provides stability and can accommodate fairly large bags
Frame is made of durable steel
Folds easily to a compact size for transport and storage
cons: Doesn't handle rough and bumpy ground very well
Not a lot of space for extras
Tends to pull to the right or left

customer_reviews.title: If you're on the fence, just get it.
customer_reviews.text: stop right here and don't worry about the other reviews complaining about this being fragile. unless you're golfing on a shale course, this will do you just fine. compact and folds up nicely. treat it well and it will treat you well. I've gone 2 seasons with this walking 18 up to 3 times a week and I still have yet to see any issues described in other poor reviews, but I take care of my things.
customer_reviews.author: Heath E. Bletzacker

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest way to walk 18 holes!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot beat the price. Very durable. Anyone giving it lower reviews need to go and spend a little more on a more expensive option. If you want to be able to walk 18 holes without carrying your clubs....this is the cheapest way to do it. So far it hasn't given me any problems. Do I wish it had a cup holder? Do I wish it had a third wheel, some sort of brake system, and a remote control? Yes....but do I want to spend hundreds of dollars? Nope. It doesn't seem like it will break anytime soon...but if it does, I still feel like I have already gotten my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Struckman

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is awesome! Simple but rolls easy and materials are of good quality. It's even better than I expected, especially because the wheels are black which looks a little classier than the white wheels pictured on the listing. Folds up small enough to fit in my SuperCab (2 door) truck.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: One of the better purchases I've made on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: One of the better purchases I've made on Amazon. This is great for our 800 yard, Par 3 course here. Two seconds to setup and "un-assemble". Folds up into a tiny space...even without removing the wheels... which THAT only takes seconds to do. ....Been better if it had wider, Velcro straps, and if the handle length was an inch or two longer (I'm 6', 4"), but well worth the purchase price!
customer_reviews.author: E3Racer

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginning golfer and have found this cart to be perfect for my needs. Essentially no assembly required, wheels just snap on. It is easy to handle: simple to fold/unfold, fairy compact, light weight, and stable on the course. Only downsides: I would prefer Velcro to the snap-in attachments on the straps which could be wider, and the scorecard holder is useless as it does not have a way to attach the scorecard. My card fell out repeatedly and had to put it in my pocket. Am planning on a paperclip work-around. However, it does the basic job of pulling my clubs very well, earning 4.5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: anneB

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, simple and functional.
customer_reviews.text: Still early in my ownership, as I've only used it once on a short par 3 9 hole course. Seems sturdy enough and rolls smooth and easy. Simple setup and collapse and for the price it's easily worth it. No frills, so I can't imagine what the base model looks like if this is "deluxe", but it seems to work for the purpose just fine. I'll update my review as I get more rounds in. First full 18 hole round walked with this cart, worked great, just need to retro-fit a cup holder for my beer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Foster

customer_reviews.title: Heavier plastic wheel spokes.
customer_reviews.text: My last cart had thin plastic in the wheel spokes, and one spoke broke the first year and I was able to repair it and it lasted another quarter of a season. This cart has thicker plastic wheels and I look for the wheels to hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Buck U

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good cart at a great price for those anticipating moderate (9-18 holes / week) use. I do wonder if the build construction is going to hold up over the years, but the price allows one to roll the dice. Pros include easy setup, light weight and compact size when folded. Cons include the above plus the fact that my cart bag seems to want to flop to one side or the other rather than staying centered. Besides being a little inconvenient for accessing the bag's pockets it makes the cart a little unbalanced when traversing rolling terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: Great golf cart
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the golf cart for my husband. After reading several reviews I made the purchase. I was a little skeptical since it was selling for a cheap price. It has gotten a workout and it's holding well. It was very easy to assemble, it's lightweight and easy to load into a car. You fold the handle down and it fits. I would recommend Jef World of Golf Deluxe Steel Golf Cart to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Turkey

customer_reviews.title: Stand bag mounts pretty good. Seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, fast shipping. I was worried that my medium size Acuity stand bag wouldn’t fit well and it’s not perfect but if you tighten the straps real tight it stays put. The hinges for the poles sit against the curved plastic. Seems pretty sturdy but I’ll know a lot more when I hit the course a few times. For the money you can’t go wrong. Only a 4 since it hasn’t been field tested.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W Stroud

customer_reviews.title: Apprehensive? Buy it. You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It’s lightweight It folds to become compact Easy to assemble Fits (seemingly) most standard size golf bags Features a place to hold your scorecard, 2 golf balls and possibly some of your tees Fair price and really affordable Cons: There are none Was apprehensive at first but after reading lots of reviews I finally went ahead and purchased this cart. After a few uses I gotta say I agree with everyone else’s assessment: it’s lightweight, it folds easily and it’s very compact. All in all I would definitely recommend this golf cart 10/10 times. If you’re on the fence about getting this cart, just do it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Covid-19 pricing
customer_reviews.text: Great cart, came with black wheels. I like to pull my cart, not push it, and this one fits the bill perfectly. Easy to maneuver, doesn`t tip easily like some other 2 wheelers. The clubs DO get in the way of the score card, but that`s not why I deducted 2 stars. The same item was selling for 1/2 the price 6 months ago before the pandemic increased the popularity of golf!
customer_reviews.author: RSR

customer_reviews.title: Good light weight push cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my wife and she likes it. While golfing she managed to roll over the cart couple of times, but that is probably something you need to get used to. Also the golf bag kept tilting toward sideways and she needed to re-adjust couple of times during the 18 holes of golf. Weight on the golf bag seems to be considered (left side vs right) and also bottom tie needs to be really tight on the golf bag. All in all, there is a place to hold gold balls, tee, and score card and protector from the rain, simply built (no complication), and she was very happy with the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Surf Cal

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lightweight cart
customer_reviews.text: It is a very lightweight cart, but just what I wanted. It seems designed well and if I don't abuse it, it should work out ok for years. I wanted a light cart, so I could place it and my clubs on my motorcycle. I liked the way the whelks folded in. It is very compact when folded. If your a rough golfer, you probably won't be happy with this, but if you are sensible on loading unloading and if rough terrain, it will do fine. I have a medium sized bag and that is about as large as I'd want to put on it, though the straps would take my older humongous bag.
customer_reviews.author: son of the hounds

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight pull cart
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Just as described. Perfect for limited storage space. This cart has held up well after 3 weeks ( 117 holes) of golf. I don't need bells and whistles, just a reliable cart. The wheel removal is great for storage and they are much more durable that I expected. I have had no issues with this product. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.Welch

customer_reviews.title: cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: good for someone who golfs occasionally. isn't fancy, but it has the basics, the wheels come off. it can get nice compact compared to others carts. DO NOT ATTEMPT to put an umbrella stand on this - it did not go well for me at all. The wind would knock over my card and break my brand new umbrella. Very little space on the bar for the mount itself. It's nice that it has a ball holder and tee holders and score card holder
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Lightweight and easy to put together. Good value for the money. Folds up nicely for easy space saving storage in trunk of car. It is working well for my husband and certainly beats carrying around his golf bag around all over 9-18 holes like he was doing before. He recommends it as a good alternative to carrying around his golf bag. He is a beginner golfer who had bought his set of golf clubs used and the bag didn’t come with wheels.
customer_reviews.author: M Moreaux

customer_reviews.title: Only used 1 time so far, no negative issues and love it.
customer_reviews.text: This cart was very easy to assemble, Is very light and I had no issues putting my clubs on it. It seems sturdy enough and I had no problems with it rolling my clubs to and around the chipping green. If I were able to walk the course I would not anticipate any issues. I like the way you can remove the wheels easily, if they were dirty you could put them in a bag to keep the dirt, grass, etc. from messing up the car.
customer_reviews.author: JonInAuburn

customer_reviews.title: Great two wheeled hand cart
customer_reviews.text: I read many Amazon reviews on different carts and I came across a comment that said "If you've been looking at different reviews, just go ahead and buy this one. You'll not be disappointed.". Well I did, and for the price and functionality, this can't be beat. Nice looking, easy to assemble and appears to be well built. I've used it twice so far and no complaints. I particularly like the square tubing vs. round for looks. No complaints other than no water bottle holder.
customer_reviews.author: JoeB

customer_reviews.title: Sounded so cheap but works so good
customer_reviews.text: I should have said works so well, but adspeak has infected us all! But honestly this little cart has worked splendidly for me . I've had it for two months, and it has proved sturdy and reliable. I've kept my clubs strapped to it, and as long as I do periodic tightening of the straps, it remains secure. I had grown so tired of schlepping my clubs, and I wanted to believe that an Amazon 'best buy' was actually that. Turns out (so far) that it is.
customer_reviews.author: jmr1944

customer_reviews.title: Great push golf cart !
customer_reviews.text: Great golf cart, lightweight, easy to assemble and great on uneven roads and golf paths. Already took it over my local golf course and it really supported my big, heavy golf bag perfectly. And the low price can’t be beat !!! Best bang for the buck on push golf carts !!
customer_reviews.author: Pilar Cannizzaro

customer_reviews.title: Lighweight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Due to the pandemic, our club was not letting their own pull carts out. I carry my bag usually, but got this pull cart for my wife to use. She really likes it. A good bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: shocked
customer_reviews.text: I'd used my friend's expensive cart and thought no way was this one going to be any good, but when you are on a budget and have a bad back you have to try. I didn't expect much for the price...but it surprised me. It is sturdy! Very solid. Hooray! Thanks!! And my back thanks you! I HIGHLY recommend this cart!
customer_reviews.author: NatEli

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. Too large for my kids' bags, but fits fine for adults. Bottom straps can dangle and get it the way, but no real complaints. Overall, decent price, does the job, hasn't broken down yet.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: Love it - Easy to assemble and use, Smooth, light and good value for $42
customer_reviews.text: Just started using it - love it so far. It’s light, smooth and was easy to put together and take apart as needed - in addition to folding wheels can be easily unlocked and popped back in in 10 seconds (yes, seconds). Assembly took less than 2 minutes. Shipping took 2 months (but to be fair, the vendor said they were back ordered due to high demand, and hence am not holding it against the vendor). Will share about durability after using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I used this "deluxe" golf cart once and then donated it. This cart is probably fine for young players who are doing par 3, but it is flimsy and uncomfortable to use for 18 holes. I should have bought a 3 wheeled cart instead, as they are more stable and easier to push or pull. This cart is well made for what it is, but frankly it's more hassle than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 5 mutes to put together and get my golf bag on it. Lightweight and easy to fold and put in my car. Not as high quality as some of the other expensive carts but factoring in the price this will work just fine. The only negative is that it took 5 weeks to arrive, other than that I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart! Light, easy to roll, and fold. Every other pull cart is so expensive. This is absolutely perfect. Only issue I had was figuring out how the wheels popped on because I didn’t realize there were little rubber protectors on when shipped. Once I took those off it was like butter. The straps are also nice and long so should fit any bag. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan VDV

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and fine for very limited use
customer_reviews.text: This was a great cheap solution for a couple of rounds of golf but only lasted a few uses. Was towing the cart behind my bicycle a short distance (about a mile) and the inner part of the wheel sheared off and is now useless. Doesn't look like you can get spare parts for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson MacFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Friendly Cart
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a budget cart to save some money with weekly cart rentals and to save my back when i decided to walk. This cart is simple and cheap. It gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Straps are on the cheaper end. But for $60 you can't expect more. If you are looking for more features you will need to spend more money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 6th grade son to use in his school golf team matches. Easy to assemble, great quality, folds down to fit in the car, even with the golf bag still attached. Great product for the price - I'll probably order one for myself too.
customer_reviews.author: Christy N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price!
customer_reviews.text: Great cart. I have used this cart several times on a 9 hole 3 par course. 4 the money compared to other products in the same price range, the quality is well above the others. There is no need for the brakes since the middle part lands on the ground. I bought 2 of these so that any golfing buddy can use the cart with me as I go on short courses. I bought a different cart and wished I bought 3 of these.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Ho

customer_reviews.title: Jef World Of Golf Deluxe Steel Golf Cart is well built at a great price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is extremely well built. We like this model so much we have purchased 3 of them. Easy to put on back of Golf cart & takes up little space;wheels are great size which makes it easy to use on all types of golf course terrain
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are newbie golfers and we purchased two of these, mostly to use when transporting clubs from car to range. These carts are terrific. Inexpensive and easy to fold. We've been using them for a couple of months now and very happy with purchase. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's suppose to do.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a chance to use this cart 4 or 5 times now. Easy to pull, stable, lightweight and folds up with little effort. It's not built like a tank but I think it will hold up well for a few years. Can't find anything wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Mike

customer_reviews.title: This product has crappy wheels that fall apart!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was made just over a month ago, and after 7 rounds of golf, the wheels fell apart. This is a cheaply made product that should be avoided!!!
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Cart
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for using when we travel by RV. We have used them a few times and they work fine. Very easy to assemble. Sturdy enough for a lightweight unit. Great price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredFF

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Golf Club Caddy For Par 3 Play
customer_reviews.text: I like this basic golf caddy because it works so well for carrying 5-6 irons around in my compact golf bag. But if you need to carry a full set of clubs this product probably won't handle a full size golf bag well. There is really not much to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase for the price I paid. Only issue is my bag does start to slip off the cart a little during my round. In 18 holes I usually readjust the bag and re-tighten the straps securing in it place about 2-3 times per round. This cart was very inexpensive and for me readjusting is not a big issue. It is way better than carrying the bag on my shoulders for a whole round.
customer_reviews.author: MightyMuffins

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the price. Have used for three rounds already with no issues. Bought three of these for myself and sons and they all work well. If you have a stand bag with legs they can shift on cart. Turning sideways worked for our bags and they held tight.
customer_reviews.author: BusyDAD

customer_reviews.title: A Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous when ordering this product because the price was so good. It's probably not gonna last 30 years if you're golfing every weekend, but it is very sturdy and will hold up well for a long time! Way better than you'd expect for this price range...Definitely a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. White

customer_reviews.title: Works great, used it for 3 rounds so far.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I have played 3 rounds with it so far. It folds easily by just sliding the locking mechanism up and folding the handle. Put the cart with bag still attached in my pickup back seat. Took 5 minutes to put the wheels on when it arrived. That's all it took. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: gmusson

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a great cart. Easy to use and not hard to assemble as it was only putting a couple of things onto the cart. Haven't really got to try it out yet so don't know how well it will hold up. Will add more review at a later time after some use.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: So far - nice.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all for the price. Holds bag securely enough. Looks classy. A little bit loose at the attachment collar, but solid enough to feel confident the handle will stay put. the thing rolls very nicely and smoothly. Stable over rougher terrain. I'd buy it again at this point. Will update if my thought change.
customer_reviews.author: P.J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great value, some annoyance.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Easy to fold and store. Two negatives: The cart won’t stand up on its own, so it is necessary to hold it up with one hand while placing the golf bag on it with the other—this is awkward. The bottom strap tends to slip off during use, no matter how tight, and will then drag on the ground, although the bag remains secure with only the top strap holding it.
customer_reviews.author: MGC

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Was borrowing a similar cart from a neighbor and ordered this, with an unknown lead time. Only a week or so later it showed up as available and shipping. It arrived intact in a unprotected box. Clipped on the wheels, loaded the bag and off to golf. Been using it for several weeks and am completely happy with this very inexpensive, light weight, cart. Not suitable for big/heavy bags...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: not pushed like the three wheeled version
customer_reviews.text: Was very surprised at the high quality steel and construction. I have only played one round with it but it was everything I was looking for in a pull cart. Be warned it is meant to be pulled, not pushed like the three wheeled version. Not a functionality thing, just a preference thing. I like to pull and it works perfectly for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and functional. Wheels are slightly larger than I expected, but that's a good thing. Had no problems pulling it through a wet course. I found that my full-sized bag is easier to strap on sideways because of the legs that flare out to make it stand up when carrying it without the cart. Will update the review if durability becomes an issue.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: quality of cart and ease of asseembly
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the quality and how easy the assembly was . I have not yet taken the cart out to the course because of unfavorable weather conditions in my area but believe it will be a great cart
customer_reviews.author: Arlene N

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart. Lightweight yet durable. I use it to take it to the driving range every day. Eliminates the wear and tear usually put on my bag's built-in stand legs. The handle folds down easily and I can put it in my trunk or back seat with the bag still attached. If you walked a lot of courses or wanted more bells and whistles, there are other models. But for quick, easy access, this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: NASCAR Lover

customer_reviews.title: Wish the wheels were a little larger
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, easy to fold and unfold, and reasonably easy to use on the course. I would give it 5 stars if the wheels were larger as on your typical 3 wheel cart., the small wheels take more effort to pull the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Good hand cart!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a low cost cart that functions well. This is a pretty good one. Simple basic cart to tote the bag! It does that. Simple to put the wheels on and get rolling. It’s a good hand cart.
customer_reviews.author: sjbrn1Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Caddy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my husband and I each one for Father’s Day! Haha and these are great! Easy assembly, they fold up nice, light weight but not cheap, they move great, and carry ours bags very nice. They have a score card holder, and tee and balls holders! Definitely getting a steal of a deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Mis

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to fold
customer_reviews.text: What I like is that it fold easily and is easy to put in my small trunk, or the back seat of my 2 door car. It manuvers well with my clubs on it. The only thing I don't like, is I now wish it had a cup holder! I would recommend this to anyone looking for an economical, easy to handle cart, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fold Up Cart
customer_reviews.text: Tried this item for the first time last week. It works fairly well. My chief complaint is the pad that the golf bag sits on is too small and needs to be expanded. Otherwise it rolled well and was easy to push/pull. I would recommend this product as a value buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Man

customer_reviews.title: What a great bargain! The wheels might be a bit cheap
customer_reviews.text: What a great bargain! The wheels might be a bit cheap, but I couldn't find any other lightweight foldable metal golf cart anywhere near the price and have used it for six months now with no problem! I don't have a large heavy bag, so I don't know how that might affect the cart's performance.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beckner

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic cart. Seems to be built well and accommodates my large bag and set of clubs just fine. I’ve used it twice and will use it again this weekend. I haven’t had any issues. I wipe the cart down, remove the wheels, and box the cart up when not in use. I would like to purchase an umbrella and holder but not sure where I’ll attach it because the handle is not very large. I’m pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: He needed it
customer_reviews.text: We just lost a loved one and my grandson took her golf clubs. They were so heavy I couldn't lift them but this little 12 year old carried them! I went right to Amazon and ordered him this to carry his clubs. He put it together and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa A. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful two wheel golf cart!
customer_reviews.text: This is the simple, old school type of carry cart. It is sturdy, easy to fold, carry and transport to the golf club.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised but the quality of this Golf Cart. I was expecting, because of the price, to receive something cheaply made. I was wrong. This is a great little cart and will save me a bundle in the cost of riding and help me fulfill my goal of getting more exercise with my golf game.
customer_reviews.author: Influence52

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is great. I beat on it pretty hard, roll it over all kinds of unsmooth surfaces, and toss it in and out of my trunk without worrying about it at all. It holds up great and is very easy to fold/ unfold. I'm really glad I got it. The only negative thing I have to say is very minor, but with my golf bag on it it is a little top heavy... meaning that if I am pulling it sideways on a hill it has tipped over once or twice. Once you know it though it's very easy to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I would say the cart is good for the price point. However I am returning per it did not fit my golf bag. The bottom strap was not even close to fitting around the bottom of my bag. The cart did seem a little “flimsy” or not very durable in comparison to other carts I have used in the past. But again, for the price point it’s not a bad option if it will fit your bag.
customer_reviews.author: nate

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is super-easy to assemble, dis-assemble and store. It does not mount my Ogio bag on the base. The straps are not strong, so you need to tied up well. Ok to pull in a course.
customer_reviews.author: Prabhu Soundarrajan

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Cart, it's a no brainer .
customer_reviews.text: Don't think paying so little you will get junk! This bag cart is great, built will and durable. My course charges $3.00 a round to rent a cart. After 12 outings you are free and clear. It folds up and never have to remove your bag from it . Buy it you can't go wrong.😀
customer_reviews.author: Brian O.

customer_reviews.title: Super durable
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made on amazon. I am I golfer and usually about 25 holes a week, and this cart comes with to every one. I’ve had it for about a 4 months now and I have not seen any wear on it, still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cart
customer_reviews.text: Light, strong, easy to pull, fits in the trunk without having to remove the wheels... great value
customer_reviews.author: joseph d

customer_reviews.title: How do I put the wheels on?
customer_reviews.text: There are no instructions. Help!! Thanks to a post, I was able to understand that you push the little thing and they slide in!!!
customer_reviews.author: Trudi

customer_reviews.title: Golf pull cart
customer_reviews.text: This is a great two wheel golf pull cart so ordered wife one also. We both love these cart and the price for this is a GREAT price
customer_reviews.author: James Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a month and a half, cheap quality. One of the wheel arms folded while out on the course and had to carry bag plus this hunk back. Wouldn’t recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rastonr

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. Serves it's purpose fully without much of a financial investment. If you are tall the wheels will bump into your heel when you're walking occasionally so hold on to the handle or watch your clubs fall over. Im going to modify mine to give an extra 6-12 in of length to keep this from happening. Solid investment though for anyone on the fence about buying a dolly or walking your rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Marshall Turner

customer_reviews.title: Easy pull
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, smooth rolling wheels. I would give it 5 stars but am not totally pleased with the angle at which it sits when at rest. My club heads block the score card holder. Otherwise, good value for the price. We will see how long it holds up for this active golfer.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Sandy Brodie

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t seem super heavy duty but it will certainly do for my 13 year old. Only drawback is that his bag is not a full size...maybe jr sized...and it didn’t reach the top. We were able to loop the strap around to secure though.
customer_reviews.author: Anne P.

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my grandchildren to play golf, and what a difference they made! Everyone was happier not carrying their clubs.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCat

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Light
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy... unfold and pop-on the wheels (which can be removed later). Lightweight and enough quality for years of golfing with the proper care. Great golf cart for the price.
customer_reviews.author: lawdog

customer_reviews.title: Best priced cart
customer_reviews.text: I have used this thing for 3 months now and for the price, it cant be beat. I feel push carts get expensive. I carry my bag alot and when I dont feel like it, this push cart is perfect. Doesn't have a water bottle holder or front wheel but its earned every dollar for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P Kelly

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: The straps are excellent, , my last cart was a hassle to secure the bag, i have nothing but good things to say about this product. Cheap at twice the price, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: The Mad Punter

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I went the cheaper route with this because my son just got into golf and I didn’t want to spend a fortune if he didn’t stick with it. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: jessica h

customer_reviews.title: Great cart
customer_reviews.text: Great golf cart for the price! Simple to set up. Only need to attach wheels and it takes literally 30 sec. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for weekend duffers- with a normal size bag!
customer_reviews.text: A great bag transport system for me, a first class duffer. Assembles and disassembles in seconds. Perfect for my small trunk convertible!
customer_reviews.author: J  J

customer_reviews.title: Much better than carrying clubs
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this years ago! Much better than breaking my back carrying clubs. Also has a convenient golf ball and tee holder.
customer_reviews.author: Metro_DC_J

customer_reviews.title: Simple rugged golf cart.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an almost identical cart that was well used before being run over by a golf cart. I was happy with that one and happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cobber

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: STOLE THIS. Amazing cart and the most bang for your buck. Bought three for my golf group and they have been incredible. Can’t believe the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Push Cart
customer_reviews.text: Nice and does well hauling my heavy golf bag. Works very swell
customer_reviews.author: Sakitulo

customer_reviews.title: Good cart...
customer_reviews.text: Good cart. Mostly metal but some plastic. Only knock, wheels could be a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wall

customer_reviews.title: WOW GREAT DEAL
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to my old cart half the price, this is a really nice cart. I've had the 3 wheel cart wasn't crazy about it, this one is perfect to maneuver, holds my full set of golf clubs easily. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: Gift to Son
customer_reviews.text: My son is deployed to South Korea so it has been sent to him. He said he likes it and it works great. Just glad to make one aspect of life easier for one of our brave military.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14 year old son that is just learning golf. It was a good product for the price. He doesn’t use it everyitme he gets his clubs out for a lesson, but the product is well made for the money, and it’s holidng up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight product for the price. Only con I see is it will not stand upright when it is folded because of the wheels
customer_reviews.author: Matt Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This cart made my granddaughter so happy. Very easy to use and maneuver. This was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann Higley

customer_reviews.title: At the public courses i play they charge about $3 ...
customer_reviews.text: At the public courses i play they charge about $3 for cart rental. I have used mine about 10 times since i got it at the end of July. Sometimes I ride but i prefer to walk when i can. I think I will use it another 40 to 50 time at least before I am ready to buy another. Maybe 100.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L.

customer_reviews.title: Drag Cart?
customer_reviews.text: Man I was excited this item showed up. With restrictions on golf cart use at the courses it was time to buy a push cart. It was just too bad they didn't send any wheels and this was a drag cart. I'm sure it works fine when all the pieces are sent, but the cart without wheels is worthless. Carried the bag again (yes I know first world problems).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be great quality for the price. It’s a little big for my daughters Wilson jr set, but it’s no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: drfrumpy

customer_reviews.title: Great cart.
customer_reviews.text: It’s so good, my wife took it and I have her fancy 4 wheel cart...
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Berquist

customer_reviews.title: Folds easily.
customer_reviews.text: Good little cart. Well constructed and inexpensive. Perfect for the trunk of a car.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the Job

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cart, well built and drives smooth.
customer_reviews.text: Is it lazy? It probably is. However, this is the greatest thing to happen to golf since Happy Gilmore. This makes carrying your bag super easy. I would have been happy with this cart at twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Hotdog

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the cost, it's a cheap pull cart that works and is simple to fold up. It is light and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Little Cart
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a pretty good push/pull cart. It is very lightweight, and easy to set up. It is also pretty durable. I walk at least nine holes everyday, and it holds up well. The only complaint I have, which kept me from giving it 5 stars is the wheels. I would rather they be solid plastic. I don't like the material (not sure exactly what it is) that surrounds the tire. Other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: "FORE!"
customer_reviews.text: Makes hauling my Double Bull for running and gunning hunting much easier. No more back strain or rubber legs (at least at my age).
customer_reviews.author: birdhunternd

customer_reviews.title: Best pull cart ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best little pull carts ever! So easy and sturdy as well
customer_reviews.author: GBColton

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. It supports my large golf bag
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It supports my large golf bag, it folds up really easily, it wheels around smoothly. There's something satisfying about saving four bucks each time I play golf. Gotta love it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E. Schare

product_meta.title: JEF WORLD OF GOLF- Deluxe Steel Push Cart
product_meta.description:
Easily transport your clubs to the green with this JEF World of Golf Deluxe Steel Golf Cart. It is made from lightweight steel, making it simple to maneuver. This folding golf cart opens and closes in a single motion. The wide wheels have a clip-on mechanism for easy removal and compact storage. This item also includes an adjustable bag strap.

Features:

 * Lightweight cart for players of all skill levels
 * Extra sturdy steel construction
 * Wide wheels with clip-on mechanism for easy removal
 * Contoured bottom for larger bags
 * Opens and closes in single motion
 * Folds in half for compact storage
 * Adjustable bag strap
 * Waterproof scorecard holder
 * Dimension: 9.30" x 10" x 9"
feature_bullets: Lightweight and sturdy, steel Deluxe Golf Cart offers easy mobility on the course
Opens and closes in one fluid motion; folds in half for compact storage
Wide wheels for stability with clip on mechanism for easy removal
Contoured bottom for larger bags with an adjustable bag strap

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
